37-year-old.context: The patient is a 37-year-old African-American female who was admitted to ABCD General Hospital with a left wrist abscess.

African-American.context: The patient is a 37-year-old African-American female who was admitted to ABCD General Hospital with a left wrist abscess.

left wrist abscess.context: The patient is a 37-year-old African-American female who was admitted to ABCD General Hospital with a left wrist abscess.

epistaxis.context: The patient was taken to the operating room for incision and drainage. Postoperatively, the patient was placed on nasal cannula oxygen and developed subsequent epistaxis.

chronic dysphonia.context: Upon evaluating the patient, the patient complains of epistaxis from the left naris as well as some chronic dysphonia that had become exacerbated after surgery.

endotracheal tube intubation.context: The patient does report of having endotracheal tube intubation during anesthesia.

inhaled steroid use.context: The patient also gives a history of inhaled steroid use for her asthma.

difficulty.context: The patient was extubated after surgery without difficulty, but continued to have some difficulty and the Department of Otolaryngology was asked to evaluate the patient regarding epistaxis and dysphonia.

Atrophic dry nasal mucosa.context: Cauterization of epistaxis, left nasal septum. Fiberoptic nasal laryngoscopy. Atrophic dry nasal mucosa.

Epistaxis.context: Cauterization of epistaxis, left nasal septum. Fiberoptic nasal laryngoscopy. Atrophic dry nasal mucosa. Epistaxis.

Atrophic laryngeal changes.context: Atrophic laryngeal changes secondary to inhaled steroid use.

Cauterization of epistaxis.context: 1. Cauterization of epistaxis, left nasal septum.   2. Fiberoptic nasal laryngoscopy.

Fiberoptic nasal laryngoscopy.context: 1. Cauterization of epistaxis, left nasal septum.   2. Fiberoptic nasal laryngoscopy.

Neo-Synephrine.context: Anesthesia: Neo-Synephrine with lidocaine nasal spray.

lidocaine nasal spray.context: Anesthesia: Neo-Synephrine with lidocaine nasal spray.

Atrophic dry cracked nasal mucosa.context: 1. Atrophic dry cracked nasal mucosa.   2. Atrophic supraglottic and glottic changes likely secondary to inhaled steroids and recent endotracheal tube intubation.

Atrophic supraglottic and glottic change.context: 1. Atrophic dry cracked nasal mucosa.   2. Atrophic supraglottic and glottic changes likely secondary to inhaled steroids and recent endotracheal tube intubation.

Ocean nasal spray.context: The patient would benefit from Ocean nasal spray as well as bacitracin ointment applied to the anterior naris.

bacitracin ointment.context: The patient would benefit from Ocean nasal spray as well as bacitracin ointment applied to the anterior naris.
